data.title: Nothing Fancy But Good Food
data.text: Small chinese restaurant offers all your favorites. Good food at good prices. Quiet family friendly environment. Traditional owner/operator.

data.title: Best Chinese food ever
data.text: The crab ragoons are the best we've ever eaten! The food here is fabulous. Try the sazuhan fish dinner and the house pan fried noodles is another of our favorites! Take out is always ready in 10 minutes and is piping hot. Nice family resturant. Food is delicious and affordable.

data.title: Really good
data.text: I am very picky when it comes to Asian food. This is a pretty good place. Of course we all have our favorite place to eat at, I do like the food there.

data.title: Good Regular Standby
data.text: Beef Teriyaki is very good, chicken fingers could have less batter but we love the duck sauce so still always order it!

data.title: It's  okay
data.text: The reason I didn't eat here all the time was because I had to go out and pick the food up.  However, I finally realized that the food here was fresh and hot.  I 've had take out and I've eatin in.  It may not be my favorite place to eat, but the food is always hot and the staff is very nice. The food is plentiful and the price is appropriate.

data.title: Great Chinese Cuisine at a great price
data.text: I've been going to Han Palace since I was a young boy, I have enjoyed their cuisine for almost 25 years and It's always delicious. The staff get your food to you in a timely manner and they are very courteous. I would also note that the food is great but so are the prices, very competetive. I highly recommend them to anyone interested in Chinese Cuisine!

data.title: more bad chinese food.
data.text: over rated chinese american food. people in this state wouldn't knw authentic chinese food if it bit them.first of all they don't eat cream cheese in china. go to any Chinatown and see what real chinese food tastes like

data.title: Freshly made & comfortable service
data.text: The owner is always on the premises, keeping regulars laughing and making new diners feel comfortable.  This is Chinese comfort food.  My favorite go to is lemon fish. Fresh vegetables in season from the garden in the back.  Friendly helpful staff are quick to take your order and deliver food.  The kitchen staff really cranks out the orders.

data.title: I have never had anything here that was not good.
data.text: I come here quite often, but even if I take a break for a while when I return Keith always remembers me as he does a lot of his patrons.  Han's in my opinion has the best crab rangoon I have ever tasted. I have tried probably about half the menu in all the years I have been going here and I have not ever had anything I didn't like. Do yourself a favor and try them out, I bet they will become a fast favorite.

data.title: My go to restaurant for eat in or take out Chinese food.
data.text:
I have been going to Han Palace for a while and never have a complaint.  I can tell you that any dish that I have had here, in my opinion, is better than the competitors up the road.   The fried rice is hands down better.  I find the fried rice at the other restaurant up the road bland.  Han's fried rice is darker and more flavorful.

I usually get the House Chop Suey, the House Marinated Chicken wings, egg rolls, and the fried rice and it is always consistent and delicious.

data.title: Han Palace, Great service, great food and great staff
data.text: We always get great service and good food from the Han Palace at a reasonable price. The manager/owner is always on site and is concerned to see that you are satisfied. We've been going to this restaurant ever since it opened about 20 years ago and it just gets better all the time.

data.title: Great Chinese Food
data.text: Have been to Han Palace many times in the past 20+ years. A great restaurant offering typical New England style American-Chinese food.

data.title: One of the best in the State!
data.text: Their food is delish! Prices are reasonable and they are never as crazy busy as that place down the street! Seriously, better food, better pricing, much more relaxed meal and all just a block further!

data.title: Not sure why this place has the ratings it does
data.text: This was the second disappointing restaurant I stopped at during my recent business trip to Warwick. The reviews make this place out to be a great stop for Chinese food. All I can say is these people have clearly not been to a good Chinese place. I stopped in on a Friday night about 7pm. The place was extremely busy and I had to wait for 10 minutes just to put in my order. I almost walked outside to call and order as I surely would have gotten my order in faster had I done so. I ordered hot and sour soup, General Tso chicken that came with rice and an eggroll, and an order of crab rangoon. The soup wasn't too bad and I would give it a 2.5/5. The crab rangoon was ok, not bad but I've certainly had better and I would give it a 2.5/5. The General Tso chicken was meh. The sauce didn't have much flavor to it and the chicken breading was rather soft and lacking any real texture to it and I would give it a 2/5. The egg roll was simply awful and I threw it away after one bite, 0/5. Based on the other high-rated reviews, I was really let down. If this is the best Chinese Warwick has to offer, then drive to Boston as I'm sure there has to be better choices there.

data.title: great food
data.text: They have the best egg rolls all there food is excellent I have had there fried rice,sweet and sour chicken,beef teriyaki, and numerous other foods and always found everything very good.

data.title: Great meal
data.text: Met family there on a Sunday afternoon. We had pupu platter, excellent. We had boneless chicken and gravy, fried Rice. Beef and broccoli. Pork chow mein. Everything was very good. Will go back again , when in area

data.title: Worst Chinese food EVER!!
data.text: My husband & I are here for work and ordered take out. Nasty!!!! In a word. We had to throw it out as nothing was edible. We ordered the General Chicken. Eggs rolls, Pupu plater. Beyond horrible.

data.title: Best crab rangoon anywhere! Go-to place for traditional Chinese food.
data.text: I am a frequent flyer at Han Palace.  The prices are reasonable and the food and service are consistently good. My favorites are the crab rangoon, egg rolls and steak terriyaki.  The Mai-Tai will knock you over for the lowest price anywhere!

data.title: a nice family style chinese restaurant
data.text:
have had good food and just fair food here many times. the food is fine and the service is good.
the. lunch special plates are limited but are tasty.
the wait staff is nice,friendly,helpful. It is in its own building and has parking front and side you can get a nice lunch for not a lot of money.

data.title: Not an impressive first visit
data.text:
We ordered take out to get a sampling of what Han Palace had to offer, as the reviews looked good.  We ordered:
steamed dumplings - average quality
egg rolls - poor quality
sesame cold noodle - completely inedible, threw them away.  They put a pile of noodles in the container, and dumped the peanut butter/sesame seed mixture on top.  How do you mix the sauce with the noodles without heating, and then what is the point of cold noodle?  Very disappointing.
shrimp fried rice - bland
